A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: From a storytelling perspective\, this movie was too long\, as so many of our generation seem to be. But the creators managed to craft a universe I was happy to sit in for 3 hours. It was like marathoning 3 episodes of an amazing TV show back to back on a giant screen. It's possible the absolutely stunning visuals are covering up some storytelling holes that I won't notice and be annoyed by until my second or third viewing\, but even so I don't hesitate with my rating. \n\nThis movie had me wringing my hands and crying and cheering from the opening scene to the end. And unlike so many Star Wars films\, it managed to utilize archetypal framing techniques while *also* subverting tired storytelling tropes. They say a good twist must be both surprising and inevitable. Go into this film expecting nothing\, and it will be perfect. Go in expecting it to validate your pet theory and you will probably be angry at it. Because this is nothing I expected. It is so very much more.
